intro: Achroanthes obtusifolia, commonly known as the blunt-leaved achroanthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves with rounded tips and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
